channel.title: Moparisthebest LUG
channel.description:
[center] [img]http://i43.tinypic.com/2u8ysrp.png[/img]
[b][u]The Unofficial Moparisthebest Linux User Group[/u][/b]
[b]Why?:[/b] In an attempt to unite the Linux users of MitB, I have created an IRC channel on the official IRC network. While you're in the channel, we will try to answer questions about Linux, share our knowledge, and possibly create Linux-specific projects. Some may say this won't get to far, but I think that there are enough Linux users in this community to create a LUG.
[b]IRC Servers:[/b] irc.moparisthebest.com tlserv.moparisthebest.com (SSL port: 6677) mitb.moparisthebest.com (SSL port: 6677) asriel.moparisthebest.com
[b]IRC Channel:[/b] [s]#linux[/s] If you need any help, ask in #mopar or PM me.
If you need help connecting, refer to: [code]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,237059.0.html[/code]
If you wish to be an avid member, you can add this to your signature :) : [code][u][url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,349466.0.html]Moparisthebest Linux User Group (MitB-LUG)[/url][/u][/code]
[/center]

item.title: Moparisthebest LUG
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I don’t know the specs of the other servers, but I do know they are both in the UK. So I guess if you are in north america my server would be faster. IRC isn’t really bandwidth intensive though, so it shouldn’t matter.

Latency, rather.

On topic kind of: Just installed Fedora 10 x64 KDE and it is very good.

item.title: Moparisthebest LUG
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:264663”]Alrighty, mitb.moparisthebest.com:6677 supports SSL. Also I have an actual certificate signed by a CA, instead of thug-life’s self-signed certificate. (thug-life, you should get one too, it’s free at http://www.cacert.org/ )

Have fun with it.[/quote]

Thank you, I’ve heard mitb.moparisthebest.com is a faster server.

Read full topic

Alrighty, mitb.moparisthebest.com:6677 supports SSL. Also I have an actual certificate signed by a CA, instead of thug-life’s self-signed certificate. (thug-life, you should get one too, it’s free at http://www.cacert.org/ )

Have fun with it.

item.title: Moparisthebest LUG
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:17, topic:264663”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=349466.msg2687722#msg2687722 date=1235774711]
I don’t mind offering SSL either, but like Mopman said, why? Are you transferring bank information over IRC or something? Not to mention that even though the info from your computer to the server would be encrypted, that same data is sent clear text from the server to clients that aren’t connected through SSL.
[/quote]

my bot (dicklord) is running on my vps, which forbids irc usage; ssl is necessary to get around this.
i often tunnel though my vps for some networks, again ssl is required because of the dumb restrictions.

also, fu mopman[/quote]

Couldn’t you just use a different port rather than 6667? Or does it sniff the packets to determine the protocol?

Read full topic

item.description:

how about get a vps in a dc that allows irc

Plus, Thug-life doesn’t go to sleep for weeks on end and let his server go down due to billing issues (you know who you are…)

Let us not forget it had been up for 200+ days before that (since we left dairc it hasnt been down)

In conclusion, cp is a big bag of gay.

item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:8, topic:264663”][quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=349466.msg2686817#msg2686817 date=1235709122]

I support it as well, great idea!

Just a note though, irc.moparisthebest.com is really the only address you need to connect to, because it points to all of those servers.

but asriel is the only good server.

I disagree, tlserv is the only one that offers SSL right now.

Plus, Thug-life doesn’t go to sleep for weeks on end and let his server go down due to billing issues (you know who you are…)
[/quote]
well I liked tlserv the most, but its going down in a few days.[/quote]

No it isn’t, Thug-life said the other day that (due to some problem or whatever) he has the box for another year. GG
